intro: Galium anisophyllon subsp. plebeium, commonly known as the slender wood-aster, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, upright stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, white to pinkish flowers arranged in clusters, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. It is native to parts of Europe and is often found in woodland edges and moist meadows. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and ecologically important species in its native habitat.
